titleproper.value:
Guide to the Charles Edward Jefferson Papers
                    <lb/>circa 1882-1941
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 3049</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-03-23T13:34-0400</date>

extent.value: in four document boxes and one box for small booklets

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection primarily includes sermons, lectures, and other writings of Charles Edward Jefferson (1860-1937). Jefferson was pastor of Broadway Tabernacle Church in New York City from 1898 to 1929, and the bulk of the collection dates from his years at that church, though the audience for many of these writings range beyond the attendees at his church services. Many of these materials are in their published form, including those on pacifism and anti-militarism in the years leading to World War I, but there are also several sermons and lectures in their original typescript form. The collection also includes Jefferson's notes on biblical texts, letters of congratulations on his 25th anniversary at Broadway Tabernacle, some Broadway Tabernacle year books, and other documents.

p.value: This collection should be cited as Charles Edward Jefferson papers, MS 3049, The New-York Historical Society.

(The above note was based largely on a 1922 biographical sketch of Jefferson found in the collection and information on the website of the 
                <extref ns2:actuate="onRequest" ns2:href="http://www.broadwayucc.org/historically-progressive/">Broadway United Church of Christ</extref>.)

The collection also includes some of Jefferson's notes on biblical texts, a record of some marriages he performed, and letters of congratulations from parishioners and associates on his 25th anniversary at Broadway Tabernacle. There is also some print matter related to Broadway Tabernacle itself including, among other documents, some year books and an Endowment Fund appeal.

subject.value: Congregational churches -- New York (State) -- New York.

dsc.value:
Series I. Sermons, Lectures, & Other Writings 2.4 Linear feet circa 1882-1937 Arrangement Note

The series is organized in two subseries:

Subseries I.A. Manuscript Writings

Subseries II.B. Published Writings

 Scope and Contents Note

The series includes a number of Charles Edward Jefferson's sermons, lectures, and other writings. Most are in a printed, published form, but several are in typed manuscript form. Most of these were delivered to the parishioners of Broadway Tabernacle Church, but other audiences are represented here as well. The container lists include all the titles of the pieces in the series.

 Subseries I.A. Manuscript Writings 0.63 Linear feet circa 1882-1937 Arrangement Note

The subseries is arranged with Jefferson's sermons in manuscript form first, in chronological order, followed by notebooks and annotated texts. Many of the sermons are numbered, and that number is included in parentheses in the container list.

 Scope and Contents Note

The subseries primarily includes typed manuscripts of some of Charles Edward Jefferson's sermons and lectures. These represent only a small number (21) of the sermons he delivered in his lifetime, but include the paper he read at his installation as pastor at Broadway Tabernacle Church in 1898. The papers often indicate the place and audience to which they were given, including universities and other schools, the Young Women's Club of Broadway Tabernacle, other churches, and other venues. Some of the remarks were delivered at various times and these were noted on the paper; this was especially true for "Old Texts Under New Skies" which records 35 deliveries from New York to California and from Montreal to Alabama. Some of the typed texts include handwritten changes.

The subseries also includes manuscript forms of some of Jefferson's other writings including a poem, three essays on nature inspired by land he owned in New Hampshire, and three notebooks and an annotated handbook concerning biblical texts.

 Paper Read at Installation of Jefferson as Pastor of Broadway Tabernacle (#-50) 1 1 1898 April 19 Commencement Oration at Delaware, Ohio (#343) 1 2 1900 June 14 Emerson and Carlyle (#615) 1 3 1903-1904 Martin Luther (#714) 1 4 1904 April 26 John Calvin (#739) 1 5 1904 November 26 John Knox (#834) 1 6 1905 November 27 Congregationalism: Past, Present & Future (#968) 1 7 1907 "All things are yours" (#1248) 1 8 1910 June 12 John Ruskin (#1269) 1 9 1910 November 28 Samuel Johnson (#1344) 1 10 1911, 1920 John Bunyan (#162-) 1 11 1914, 1918 The Mission of Hobab (#1949) 1 12 1917 December 2 Vicarious Suffering (#1948) 1 13 1917 December 2 The Things of God: III. The Holy Catholic Church (#2105) 1 14 1918 March 10 Robert Browning (#2132) 1 15 1918 China 1 16 1926 December 8 Old Texts Under New Skies (#2716) 1 17 1926-1934 The Mind of Lindbergh (#2792) 1 18 1927 June 16 John Ruskin (#2947) 1 19 1929 November 25 The Rich Young Ruler 1 20 1931-1937 What Do You Think of God? 1 21 1931-1937 It is Raining (Poem) 2 1 1930 No. 1: My Eight Acres 2 2 undated No. 3: Grass 2 3 undated No. 7: Snow 2 4 undated The Psalms, Vol. I (Notebook) 2 5 undated [Notes on New Testament] 2 6 undated Scope and Contents Note

Notebook includes notes on the text of the Gospels of the New Testament, including comparisons of content, of differences in particular narrative scenes, characteristics of each Book, etc.

 [Notebook] 2 7 1908-1909 Scope and Contents Note

Includes the marketing form of Jefferson's booklet "The Old Year and the New," which has the cloth cover design and interior blank pages. Under the heading "The Beautiful," the first few blank pages have entries for various days from 1908 June 8 to 1909 January 29 with various observations.

 Minister's Hand-Book (annotated) 2 8 circa 1882? Scope and Contents Note

Includes a copy of the second edition of Savage's "Minister's Hand-Book," with Jefferson's notes and annotations.

 Subseries II.B. Published Writings 1.77 Linear feet 1899-1936 Arrangement Note

The container list below is arranged, with one set of exceptions, in chronological order. The one exception are the annual sermons Jefferson delivered to the boys and girls of Broadway Tabernacle; these are presented together in chronological order at the end of the container list. Because of the wide range of sizes of the documents, the booklets and books themselves were boxed in an appropriate manner for storage and, as can be discerned from the various box numbers in the container list, do not strictly follow the order as presented in the list.

 Scope and Contents Note

The subseries includes the sermons, essays, and other writings of Charles Edward Jefferson that appeared in printed form. Most of these took the form of small booklets. Among these are Jefferson's remarks at the memorial service for assassinated U.S. president William McKinley, his expressions of pcifism and anti-militarism in the years around World War I, the annual sermons he delivered to the boys and girls of Broadway Tabernacle, a biographical sketch (1922), his reflections on Congregationalism, and other topics. Many of the booklets have multiple copies, as many as five copies in some cases.

 The Person of Christ 5 1899 Sermon at the 73rd Anniversary of the American Seamen's Friend Society 3 1 1901 Address at the Memorial Service for President William McKinley 5 1901 Congregationalism: Its Origin, Principles and Mission 5 1901 60th Anniversary of Broadway Tabernacle Church 3 2 1901 Scope and Contents Note

Includes two booklets: "The Broadway Tabernacle of the Past and Future," by Jefferson and a program of the week's events (January 16-23), with two images of the interiors of the old and new buildings.

 Congregationalism: Its Contribution to Education 5 1902 Things Fundamental: A Course of Thirteen Discourses in Modern Apologetics 3 1 1903 The Puritan and the Home 5 1904 Fundamentals 3 2 1907 Scope and Contents Note

Published by the Young Men's Christian Association Press.

 The Next Step 3 3 1909 Scope and Contents Note

Published by the Young Men's Christian Association Press.

 The Puritan Conscience 5 1909 The Delusion of Militarism 3 3 1909 Scope and Contents Note

Reprint from the Atlantic Monthly, 1909 March.

 Missions and International Peace 3 4 1910 Congregationalism (2 copies) 3 4-5 1910 A Message to the Perplexed 5 1913 A New Year's Sermon 5 1914 The Nemesis of Armaments 3 5 1914 Scope and Contents Note

Published by the New York Peace Society; reprint from The Independent, 1914 August 17.

 Three Men Behind the Guns 3 6 1914 Scope and Contents Note

Published by the American Association for International Conciliation.

 The Cause of the War 3 7 1914 Scope and Contents Note

Includes two versions of the booklet, one published by the Church Peace Union as the first in a series of papers under the heading of "The Church and International Peace." The second version was published by Thomas Y. Crowell Co.

 The Puritan and the Cavalier 5 1914 A Great Church in a Great City (Broadway Tabernacle's 75th Anniversary) 5 1915 What Armed Peace Leads To 3 8 1916 Ethical Questions Created by Our Government's Declaration of War 5 1917 Jefferson's 20th Anniversary Discourse 3 6 1918 The Question Which Answers Itself 5 1918 A New Year's Sermon: Removing Mountains 5 1920 Pilgrim Tercentenary Sermon 5 1920 A New Year's Sermon: Stand Upon They Feet 5 1921 Biographical Sketch of Charles Edward Jefferson 5 1922 The Heavenly Vision 5 1922 "Come, Let Us Reason Together" 5 1922 The Appeal of the Christian Ministry 3 9 1922 The Friendship Indispensable 3 7 1923 New Men and New Years 3 10 1924 Faith 5 1924 "I Don't Know What I Believe" 5 1926 The Puritan 5 1926 Expectancy / "Maranatha" 5 1927 Streams in the Desert 5 1927 Like a Trumpet 5 1927 Thinking Peace 5 1927 The Next Step 3 11 1928? Scope and Contents Note

Undated reprint (International Peace Series, Number 6) by the World Alliance for International Friendship Through the Churches of Jefferson's 1928 sermon preached on the tenth anniversary of the signing of the armistice ending World War I.

 Jefferson's 30th Anniversary at Broadway Tabernacle 2 9 1928 Scope and Contents Note

Includes two booklets: Jefferson's sermon preached on the occasion of his 30th anniversary (3 copies) and "Thirty Years on Broadway."

 The One Foundation 5 1929 Obedience to Law 5 1929 A Charge to the Officers of the Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor 5 1929 Watch Night Sermon: Facing the Future 5 1929 "I remember the days of old." Psalms 143.5 3 12 1931 [The Character of Jesus] 4 8 1935 Scope and Contents Note

Book translated into Czech. Inscribed to Jefferson by the translator. Pages uncut.

 Acknowledging Our Blessings 3 13 1936 Sermons to the Boys and Girls of the Broadway Tabernacle - -- The Duty of Asking Questions 5 1902 My Father's Business 5 1904 The Silent Years 5 1905 Work 5 1906 The Will 5 1907 Honesty 5 1908 Being A Christian 5 1909 The Sin of Untruthfulness 5 1910 Lions and Adders 5 1911 A Brave Builder 5 1912 The Two Roads 5 1913 The Tongue 5 1914 Preparedness 5 1916 Discipline 5 1917 Foundations of Sapphires 5 1918 Wings 5 1919 The Mayflower 5 1920 Five Wrong Ideas of God 5 1921 Play 5 1923 The Wedge of Gold 5 1924 Jonah 5 1925 What the Chairs Say 5 1926 The Most Beautiful Thing in the World 5 1927 War 5 1928 Our Little Brothers and Sisters 5 1929 Fun 5 1930 Series II. Other Documents 0.52 Linear feet 1898-1941 Scope and Contents Note

The series includes documents from the collection other than Jefferson's sermons and writings. Some of these relate directly to Jefferson, including a record of some marriage ceremonies he performed and congratulatory letters he received on the occasion of his 25th anniversary at Broadway Tabernacle. Other documents relate to the church itself, including an appeal for the Endowment Fund (circa 1900?), an information pamphlet (1902), and some Year Books. There are also a small number of documents not related directly to either Jefferson or Broadway Tabernacle. The container list identifies all content.

 Arrangement Note

The subseries is arranged topically, first with material related directly to Jefferson, followed by that related to Broadway Tabernacle generally, and concluding with miscellaneous items.

 Photographs 2 10 circa 1900, 1930? Scope and Contents Note

Includes two portrait photographs of Jefferson.

 Sermon Booklet / Loose Paper Slips 2 11 circa 1904 Scope and Contents Note

Includes a copy of the published sermon to the boys and girls of Broadway Tabernacle of 1904 May 8. Tucked between many of the booklet pages are very small slips of paper with names, codes, and impressionistic facial sketches. Other slips have dollar amounts noted on them. Use caution in handling the booklet in order not to lose the small slips.

 Marriage Ceremony Record Stubs 2 12 1898-1900 Scope and Contents Note

Record of 10 marriages (numbered 10-19) performed by Jefferson.

 Annotated Epistles 2 13 1902 Scope and Contents Note

Includes a pocket size copy of some New Testament epistles, with annotations.

 Christmas Builders 2 14 undated Scope and Contents Note

Includes binding and unprinted pages for Jefferson's book.

 Jefferson's 25th Anniversary. Bound Congratulatory Letters from Parishioners 4 18 1923 Jefferson's 25th Anniversary. Bound Congratulatory Letters from Associates and Friends 4 19 1923 Broadway Tabernacle Church. Endowment Funds 2 15 circa 1900? Broadway Tabernacle Church Information Pamphlet 2 16 1902 Broadway Tabernacle Church Year Book 4 9 1898 Broadway Tabernacle Church Year Book 4 10-17 1920-1928 Scope and Contents Note

Includes books for 1920, 1921, 1922, 1924, 1926, 1927, 1928 (2 copies).

 Broadway Tabernacle Tidings 2 17 1941 Manhattan Congregational Church 13th Annual Report 2 18 1910 "The God of War." Poem by Israel Zangwill 2 19 circa 1911 Practical Guide No. 10: Correcting Weight and Figure 2 20 1926 Scope and Contents Note

Booklet is part of "Twelve Weeks to Health," the Arthur A. McGovern Course in Health Building by Practical Hygiene, Organic Stimulation and Functional Re-Education.
